title: If you're a jungler and you decide "I won't gank this lane for whatever reason" then don't jungle
body: Unless your laner says not to, or they're 0/10, you should ALWAYS be trying to help a lane pushed in. It's your job to assist lanes. If you're gonna use this train of logic, please, don't jungle. Go play support, because I don't mind if my support isn't coming to help me mid while I'm under tower or top with the enemy jugnler camping me.

replies.body: This is almost entirely false. As a jungle you make the decision to go where it benefits the team the most. Hint: It is almost always never the laner that is crying for ganks.
How's this for decision making: your top is under turret, the enemy top has no flash. Your mid is pushing the enemy under their turret, who do you gank?

Idk bro, where is the enemy jungler? What is the status of the towers? How quickly can laners follow up? Which junglers are on the map? Which toplaners are on the map? What level are all players involved? Which summoners are burned? What vision do you have? What vision do they have? Is your toplaner an idiot? Do you have buffs? Do they have buffs? Does the enemy toplaner have an escape in his kit? Is dragon on the table? Is it worth losing objectives on the other side of the map if the enemy jungler isnt on your side? Will your toplaner throw once you give him a lead?

Enemy jungler just showed mid and went bot, your bot is backing. Towers are all above 80%, your top pinged the enemy top so he's ready. Both top laners are under your tower, Both tops are 5, you're a lvl 4 Lee Sin. Top hasn't warded. Enemy top has no flash. Wind Dragon is up but both bot laners just backed and it's way too early.
Way too much vital info missing, but botlane countergank sounds best so far.

I think this should be restated as "if you're a jungler and unwilling to adapt by ganking a different lane when what you've been doing isn't working, please don't play jungle".

It gets pretty annoying when I'm top lane, constantly pushed in with a control ward in river brush, and never receive a gank when it's practically a certain kill. Meanwhile jungle is ganking mid/bot and not getting anything for it, sometimes even dying because mid/bot sucks / enemy counterganked with no vision.

I don't mind not receiving ganks if the rest of the map is working well. I have no issue being carried. My issue is when I know I could start going and contribute significantly to the team, and meanwhile no resources are sent to my lane and they're wasted elsewhere as we fall farther and farther behind. Even worse if the enemy jungler is camping my lane as I can't even make something happen 1v1 to try to get my team in it.
None of his ganks were working well, but he was only helping his friend in mid.

I'd like to clarify a few of the issues in your post in the nicest ways possible.

1. NEVER GANK A LOST CAUSE. If a lane is losing hard enough (matchup varying), then even if you gank that lane odds are they will be useless due to being so far behind giving the fed laner even more kills. ONLY GANK LANES THAT CAN FOLLOW UP AND ALWAYS PING WHEN YOU GO TO GANK, not everyone is able to look at the mini-map every 3 seconds when they're in a hard matchup and trying to get as much CS as their enemy laner allows without getting all-in killed. 

2. You don't have to always assist lanes directly, the in-direct approach is abusing the enemy jungler. If you abuse the enemy jungler enough then it delays them throughout the game and makes their ganks much weaker due to the lack of levels and items. This makes teamfights one man down due to the jungler having less income and levels than their team's support. Also making smite-steals easier due to the level advantage. 

3. USUALLY, only help push lanes into the enemy tower IF THE ENEMY CHAMPION ISN'T ITEM DEPENDENT OR IT'S FAR ENOUGH INTO THE GAME (this applies mainly to top lane only). Sometimes it's best to keep lanes pushed to your own tower. Freezing lanes like this, even if the enemy laner is missing or dead, makes it so they can't return to lane for farm. If setup correctly, the only way they can farm is to either deny their own jungler camps or to put themselves way out of position to be ganked and to die again. If the enemy laner surrenders the lane due to this, as the laner feel free to break the freeze to draw attention back to you so they can't focus down other places of the map without losing towers.

Speaking as a jungle main myself this is the way i see the jungle.
1) MOST junglers main thing to do is farm until 6 as many are useless pre 6 perfect example current warwick. If i am ganking early it better be that your lane is pushed in and you are going to help follow up. If i get stomped trying to help you cause they are 5-6ish and i am 4 i DON'T want to hear you crying about how i am a bad jungler/suck etc or blame me for him getting a kill if you don't help it's not my fault and i will not be back in your lane period.

2) If your lane is pushed in and i am at the other end of the map i am not rushing up there to bail you out you have to play your lane as well as i have to play my jungle. If i go to a lane everytime it's pushed in leaving my farm i'll fall behind becoming useless so at this point i say either play safer until i get there or i am applying pressure to another lane to force their jungle out to me or to get a tower. My objective is objectives not coming at a call like a dog even if i am on warwick.

3) I am going to to what is right for the team not just one player. I am not going to keep camping top for my bot lane to be crushed when i can crush that lane. If they are pushing a lot and can't capitalize i am going to bale out bottom as they are holding their own and i can take the damage out of their teams sails. Just like if bot is playing fine crying for ganks and top is holding well and getting pushed in a little and they are wreckless like the bot example above i will crush the top laner. 

4) Considering almost every game i jungle i am usually the tank as well i am of course going to be more worried about my mid and bot doing well cause if they fail we have no damage which means no team fight which means game over. The only times my scores have went negative is when mid and bot fed so hard that i could not fix the issue i rarely go neg when our top looses lane. 

These are my 4 main views on how i jungle and that is why i still have a 60%+ win rate on shyvanna and all my scores are high on her even then sometimes with the best basics you can't carry them all.
